ai-sn55:37.4.4_0: Then they’re considered to be a faithful lay follower.”
ai-sn55:37.5.1_0: “But how is a generous lay follower defined?”

ai-sn55:37.6.1_0: “But how is a wise lay follower defined?”

ai-sn55:52.5.1_0: “But sir, during this rains residence did you hear and learn anything in the presence of the Buddha?”

ai-sn55:52.5.3_0: ‘There are fewer mendicants who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-sn55:52.5.4_0: There are more mendicants who, with the ending of the five lower fetters, are reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.’
ai-sn55:52.6.1_0: In addition, I heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-sn55:52.6.2_0: ‘There are fewer mendicants who, having ended the five lower fetters, are reborn spontaneously, and will be extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.
ai-sn55:52.6.3_0: There are more mendicants who, with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, are once-returners, who come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.’
ai-sn55:52.7.1_0: In addition, I heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-sn55:52.7.2_0: ‘There are fewer mendicants who, with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, are once-returners, who come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.
ai-sn55:52.7.3_0: There are more mendicants who, with the ending of three fetters are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.’”
